senses.de: To decide or determine something after a period of thought or research
senses.ex: After examining all the evidence, the detective concluded that the butler was the culprit

Tips.title: After Investigation
Tips.description: Used when making a final decision after careful thought or research.
Tips.example: The jury concluded that the defendant was innocent.

Tips.title: Final Decision
Tips.description: Indicates a decision is the last step after exploring all options.
Tips.example: We concluded to choose the blue design after seeing all samples.

senses.de: To finish or bring something to an end
senses.ex: The concert concluded with a spectacular fireworks display

Tips.title: Closing Events
Tips.description: Refers to the last part or final moments of an event or action.
Tips.example: The meeting concluded with a round of applause.

Tips.title: Wrap It Up
Tips.description: Suggests completion of an action, speech, or written work.
Tips.example: She concluded her essay with a poignant quote.

senses.de: To formally and legally settle or arrange something such as a contract
senses.ex: They concluded an agreement for a new trade treaty

Tips.title: Agreement Formality
Tips.description: Indicates the formal finalization of agreements, especially legal ones.
Tips.example: The nations concluded a peace treaty after long negotiations.

Tips.title: Legally Binding
Tips.description: Used to express the completion of a contract that is official and enforceable by law.
Tips.example: The company concluded a binding agreement with its employees.

senses.de: To infer or judge from evidence or premises
senses.ex: From the clues left at the scene, the detective concluded that it was an inside job

Tips.title: Deriving Conclusions
Tips.description: Used when forming an opinion or explanation based on available information.
Tips.example: Examining the data, she concluded that the hypothesis was correct.

Tips.title: Evidence to Judgment
Tips.description: Marks the move from specific details to general understanding or judgement.
Tips.example: He concluded from the symptoms that the patient had a rare disease.

Decider.wordDefinition:
A decider is a person or thing that performs the action of making a decision. For example, in a sports match, the final shot or goal that determines the winner can be called the 'decider.'.

Conclude describes the process of making a decision, while decider describes the person or thing that makes the final decision.

Deduce.wordDefinition:
Deduce means to reach a conclusion or inference through reasoning, especially from something known or assumed.

It is used when you are making an assumption based on known facts or logical deductions. For example, "Based on the evidence we have collected, we can deduce that the suspect was at the scene of the crime.".

In simpler terms, conclude is used when you have arrived at a decision based on evidence or reasoning, while deduce is used when you make a conclusion based on the facts presented to you.

Determine.wordDefinition:
Determine means to establish or find out something through investigation, testing or calculation. It is applicable when trying to establish a fact, solution or outcome.

For example, "The doctors ran several tests to determine the cause of the patient's symptoms."

Conclude is used when making a decision or judgment based on evidence, while determine is used when trying to establish a fact or solution through investigation.

Finish.wordDefinition:
Finish means to come to an end or complete a task. It suggests that something has been accomplished or completed.

For example, "I need to finish my essay before the deadline."

Conclude is used when a decision is made based on evidence or facts, while finish is used when a task is completed.

Infer.wordDefinition:
Infer means to make an educated guess or draw a conclusion based on evidence or reasoning.

For example, if we see a broken glass on the floor, we can infer that someone dropped it. But if we investigate further and find fingerprints and witness statements identifying the person who dropped the glass, we can conclude that it was that person who broke the glass.

Resolve.wordDefinition:
Resolve means to find a solution to a problem or difficult situation. It is applicable when there is a need to fix a problem or resolve a conflict.

Conclude is about making a decision and resolve is about solving a problem.

Settle.wordDefinition:
Settle, on the other hand, means to resolve a dispute or come to an agreement. It's often used to describe the end of a conflict, typically between two parties, where a compromise has been reached.

So, for example, you might conclude a project after reviewing all the results and presenting them to your boss. But you might settle a disagreement with a friend by finding a compromise that makes both of you happy.

Conclude is often used to describe the end of a process or discussion, whereas settle is often used to describe the resolution of a dispute or conflict.

quotes.Text: I began making pictures because I wanted to record what supports hope: the untranslatable mystery and beauty of the world. Along the way, however, the camera also caught evidence against hope, and I eventually concluded that this, too, belonged in pictures if they were to be truthful and thus useful.
quotes.Title: American Photographer
quotes.Name: Robert Adams

quotes.Text: Leadership is solving problems. The day soldiers stop bringing you their problems is the day you have stopped leading them. They have either lost confidence that you can help or concluded you do not care. Either case is a failure of leadership.
quotes.Title: American Statesman
quotes.Name: Colin Powell

quotes.Text: Very few negotiations are begun and concluded in the same sitting. It's really rare. In fact, If you sit down and actually complete your negotiation in one sitting, you left stuff on the table.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Christopher Voss

quotes.Text: Rarely does an interviewer ask questions you did not expect. I have given a lot of interviews, and I have concluded that the questions always look alike. I could always give the same answers.
quotes.Title: Italian Journalist
quotes.Name: Italo Calvino

quotes.Text: Thanking you once more, I want to wish you the best of luck for your future life and to conclude by saying to you: Dream your dreams and may they come true!
quotes.Title: Swiss Scientist
quotes.Name: Felix Bloch

quotes.Text: Many people have observed that truth is stranger than fiction. This has led some intellectuals to conclude that it's stranger than non-fiction as well.
quotes.Title: American Artist
quotes.Name: Brad Holland

quotes.Text: There is not in the world so toilsome a trade as the pursuit of fame; life concludes before you have so much as sketched your work.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Jean de la Bruyere

quotes.Text: After watching a movie, you can't conclude that I am the same person in real life too.
quotes.Name: Sana Khan

quotes.Text: We have not yet concluded that needle-exchange programs do not encourage drug use.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Donna Shalala

quotes.Text: I have concluded that we are in a world made by rules created by an intelligence.
quotes.Title: American Physicist
quotes.Name: Michio Kaku
